Previous influenza infection epidemics have been associated with myocardial infarction, myocarditis and exacerbated heart failure.
6 These comorbid conditions contribute to significant mortality. Previous coronarvirus epidemics such as SARS in 2002 and Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) were associated with tachycardia, bradycardia, cardiomegaly, cardiac arrest, sub-clinical diastolic impairment and acute-onset heart failure.
